comments:

It sounds like your installation is corrupt/incomplete. Please re-install in a 
new directory and see if the problem persists.

I've observed this problem happens only when I open files outside of the project
(source files belonging to a jar).
The installation is fresh.
The only strange thing I have done is to open a workspace created with Eclipse
3.0.1.
Everything has been migrated ok except for view layout.

The stack trace shows that a non SDK plug-in (jadclipse) is accessing a non 
API class which no longer exists in 3.1. This problem needs to be filed 
against jadclispe.
